# ATTENTION: Page is Moving!
Updates will now happen over 

[here](https://github.com/monkey100/replaceport/wiki).

 This page is out on its own a bit, and would benefit from more collaboration. So I'm going to throw my lot in with O-Doc's effort.


# ReplacePort Info Page

This page is a central repository of all useful information for people helping to create a community-run Kerbal Space Program mod hosting site.

UPDATE: Slight change of purpose: because several people are now writing their own design documents (which are better than anything I would have time to create), this page now **links to useful info, rather than hosts it**. More of a portal than a design document itself.

See this forum thread: [forum thread](http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71133-Community-Mod-Repository-and-The-Majiir-Challenge)

**Nothing is set in stone yet**, so if you have a better idea about something listed here, **please say so**. Or if you know of a better place to host this info, feel free to do so. Ask me and I can provide you with the Markdown or HTML source (tables are annoying to copy).

##The Story So Far

Majiir noticed a while back (in february) that Kerbal Space Port was getting increasingly inadequate for the modding community's needs, so he announced a Challenge for someone to develop a new replacement, which he had the resources to sufficiently host.

What with the announcement on May that [Curse are taking over mod management](http://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/post/84927345579/kerbal-space-program-curse-com-partner-together-for) and [Kerbal Space Port](http://kerbalspaceport.com/) is being closed on the 30th May, interest has spiked in building a new mod hosting platform.

Currently, various parallel efforts are being made to build a site, which you can read about on the aforementioned [forum thread](http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71133-Community-Mod-Repository-and-The-Majiir-Challenge), and on the section titled Known Projects Being Worked On, further down.

["What we lack is a cohesive set of core features. In other words, we haven't yet (in my opinion) established a good starting point."](http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71133-Community-Mod-Repository-and-The-Majiir-Challenge?p=1001647&viewfull=1#post1001647) - Majiir

Let's change that. Let's build a development roadmap, shall we?

***

I'll make this page editable to interested parties, but in the meantime here's what I've gleaned from the thread.

##Resources & Links
* [Forum thread](http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71133-Community-Mod-Repository-and-The-Majiir-Challenge)
* [Design Document](https://onedrive.live.com/view.aspx?resid=131B3D0DB2B5645E!13895&ithint=file%2c.docx&app=Word&authkey=!AI8mdtoB8fHqr8s) made in March by TrueBorn
* [Majiir's Preferences](http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71133-Community-Mod-Repository-and-The-Majiir-Challenge?p=1004462&viewfull=1#post1004462) on technologies used in the server. As he says, **opinion, not fact**, but a good starting point for least resistance.
* [Minus 100 points](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ericgu/archive/2004/01/12/57985.aspx), by Eric Gunnerson. A short article on "additive development", or creating from scratch (rather than comparing to an existing system, and bringing all its baggage into the new development process)
* [RadGH's Design Document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qvzyA1vLMmfBkxFihQJpl_XPMgoQaLjaF05O-8z4wBY/edit#heading=h.ecj0o5ek98cj), a refined version (by RadGH) of the notes I previously posted here.
